radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Enhanced depth imaging optical coherence tomography (EDI-OCT)
radiographic_examinations.findings: Foveal thinning with distortion and loss of the outer nuclear layer (ONL), external limiting membrane (ELM), ellipsoid zone (EZ), and retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) bilaterally. Central foveal thickness was 175 µm for the right eye (RE) and 170 µm for the left eye (LE); choroid thickness was 275 µm and 276 µm, respectively.

Centrally located area with irregular borders showing hypoautofluorescence due to RPE atrophy with surrounding rim of hyperautofluorescence consistent with RPE damage. Area of hypoautofluorescence around the optic discs at the site of atrophy.
Granular hyperfluorescence in the macula and concomitant areas of fenestrated loss with visible choriocapillaris. No obvious abnormalities in contrast flow through the main vessels.

Lowering of a and b waves in light-adapted 3 ERG and LA 30 Hz ERG; prolonged peak times of a and b waves under photopic adaptation conditions, significantly worse in the right eye (RE). Normal dark-adapted 0.01 ERG and DA3.
